original_content:
message_id: 177650cf1868cf8e
subject   : Subject: ONE PURPOSE AMID MANY VARIETIES (2-3-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 2 Feb 2021 17:21:23 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Now there are different kinds of spiritual *

*gifts, but it is the same* *kinds of Holy Spirit who is the source of them
all *(I Cor. 12:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Let us remember that there is a beauty in God’s people that being that they
serve

with the variety of gifts given to them by

the Holy Spirit. Paul mentioned some:

“To one there is given through the Spirit

the message of wisdom, to another the mess-age of knowledge, -- to another
faith, -- to another the gifts of healing” (I Cor.12:8) and so on. The
Holy Spirit has one purpose in

distributing the spiritual gifts in so great a variety, and that is that
Christians not only profess but also proclaim that “Jesus is Lord” (I Cor.
12:3). What a privilege!

* Pastor Sather*

*Remember to always ask the Holy Spirit *

*to assist you in pro**perly using the gifts He has entrusted to you for
the sake of **Jesus, *

*your Savior.*
original_reflection_text:
Let us remember that there is a beauty in God’s people that being that they serve with the variety of gifts given to them by the Holy Spirit.
Paul mentioned some: “To one there is given through the Spirit the message of wisdom, to another the message of knowledge, -- to another faith, -- to another the gifts of healing” (I Corinthians 12:8)
and so on. The Holy Spirit has one purpose in distributing the spiritual gifts in so great a variety, and that is that Christians not only profess but also proclaim that “Jesus is Lord” (I Corinthians 12:3). What a privilege!
original_verse_text: Now there are different kinds of spiritual gifts, but it is the same kinds of Holy Spirit who is the source of them all.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the diverse gifts You have bestowed upon Your people through the power of the Holy Spirit. May we use these gifts to proclaim the Lordship of Jesus Christ and to build up Your Church, that all may see the beauty of Your people united in service. Grant us wisdom, knowledge, and faith to fulfill the purpose for which You have called us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Let us remember that there is a beauty in God's people, in that they serve with the variety of gifts given to them by the Holy Spirit. Paul mentioned some: "To one there is given through the Spirit the message of wisdom, to another the message of knowledge, to another faith, to another the gifts of healing" (1 Corinthians 12:8) and so on. The Holy Spirit has one purpose in distributing the spiritual gifts in so great a variety, and that is that Christians not only profess but also proclaim that "Jesus is Lord" (1 Corinthians 12:3). What a privilege!
subject: One Purpose Amid Many Varieties
verse_text: Now there are different kinds of spiritual gifts, but it is the same kinds of Holy Spirit who is the source of them all.

original_content:
message_id: 1776a67804846b33
subject   : Subject: GOD GIVES THE HUMBLE A LIFT (2-4-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 3 Feb 2021 18:18:24 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*He has brought down rulers from their*

*thrones but has lifted up the humble. *

*(Lk. 1:52)*


Today’s * Reflection:*

How quickly God can bring down the

proud and powerful! As the psalmist

warned, “Do not put your trust, in mortal

men, who cannot save. When their spirit

departs, they return to the ground; on

that very day their plans come to nothing”

*Ps. 146:3-4)*

Who alone saves? Of course it is Jesus

Christ, the Son of God, who by the works

of His own hands, the travail of His soul

in the Garden of Gethsemane, and His

death on the cross restored what

Adam and Eve forfeited: the inher-

itance of eternal life…



*Let us remember to ask the heavenly *

*Father to give **us the humble **mind of *

*Jesus Christ and to help us walk **in His *

*steps.*

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
How quickly God can bring down the proud and powerful! As the psalmist warned, “Do not put your trust, in mortal men, who cannot save. When their spirit departs, they return to the ground; on that very day their plans come to nothing” Psalm 146:3-4)
Who alone saves? Of course it is Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who by the works of His own hands, the travail of His soul in the Garden of Gethsemane, and His death on the cross restored what Adam and Eve forfeited: the inher itance of eternal life... Let us remember to ask the heavenly Father to give us the humble mind of Jesus Christ and to help us walk in His steps.
original_subject: GOD GIVES THE HUMBLE A LIFT
original_verse_text: He has brought down rulers from their thrones but has lifted up the humble.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that our trust should not be in the fleeting power of mortal men, but in Your eternal, saving grace. Help us to walk in the humble steps of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who by His sacrifice on the cross has restored the inheritance of eternal life that was forfeited. May we not be proud, but rather receive the grace You so freely offer to the humble. Amen.
reflection: How quickly God can bring down the proud and powerful! As the psalmist warned, "Do not put your trust in mortal men, who cannot save. When their spirit departs, they return to the ground; on that very day their plans come to nothing" (Psalm 146:3-4). Who alone saves? Of course, it is Jesus Christ, the Son of God, who by the works of His own hands, the travail of His soul in the Garden of Gethsemane, and His death on the cross restored what Adam and Eve forfeited: the inheritance of eternal life. Let us remember to ask the heavenly Father to give us the humble mind of Jesus Christ and to help us walk in His steps.
subject: God Gives the Humble a Lift
verse_text: He has brought down rulers from their thrones but has lifted up the humble.

original_content:
message_id: 1776f49956188887
subject   : Subject: PATIENCE PAYS OFF (2-5-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 4 Feb 2021 17:03:49 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verses:*
*"God sets Himself against the proud, but He shows favor*
*to the humble. So humble yourselves under the mighty*
*Power of God, and in His good time He will honor you.*
* (I Pet. 5b-6)*

*Today's Reflection:*
*We often worry about position and status, hoping to get*
*proper recognition for what we do. But Peter advises us*
*to remember that God's recognition counts more than*
*human praise. God is able and willing to bless us according*
*to His timing. Humbly obey God regardless of present *
*circumstances, and His good timing--either in this life*
*or in the next--He will honor you!*
* Pastor Sather*
*Let us seek the Holy Spirit's leading to give us patience*
*to wait for God's blessing . . . *
original_reflection_text: We often worry about position and status, hoping to get proper recognition for what we do. But Peter advises us to remember that God's recognition counts more than human praise. God is able and willing to bless us according to His timing. Humbly obey God regardless of present circumstances, and His good timing--either in this life or in the next--He will honor you!
original_verse_text: God sets Himself against the proud, but He shows favor to the humble. So humble yourselves under the mighty Power of God, and in His good time He will honor you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that Your recognition and timing are far more important than the praise of this world. Help us to let go of our desires for status and position, and instead, seek to obey You faithfully, trusting in Your perfect plan for our lives. May we find our worth and purpose in You alone, knowing that in due time, You will honor those who humble themselves under Your mighty hand. We surrender our lives to You, Lord. Amen.
reflection: We often worry about position and status, hoping to get proper recognition for what we do. But Peter advises us to remember that God's recognition counts more than human praise. God is able and willing to bless us according to His timing. Humbly obey God regardless of present circumstances, and His good timing—either in this life or in the next—He will honor you!
subject: Patience Pays Off
verse_text: God sets Himself against the proud, but He shows favor to the humble. So humble yourselves under the mighty Power of God, and in His good time He will honor you.

original_content:
message_id: 177743b0d9657ed9
subject   : Subject: BELIEVING IN THE WORD (2-6-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 5 Feb 2021 16:06:03 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Since God did not even spare His own Son but*

*gave Him up for us all, won’t God, who gave us *

*Christ, also give us everything else? *(Ro. 8:32)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Do you ever think that you are not good enough

for God, so He surely will not save you? Do you

ever feel as if salvation is for everyone else?

Then this verse is especially for you. If God gave

His Son for the world*, *He isn’t going to hold the

the gift of salvation from you! If Christ gave His

life for you, He isn’t going to turn around and

condemn you! He will not withhold anything

you need to serve Him. The book of Roman’s

is an explanation of God’s redeeming grace—

it’s meant to be a book of comfort and confid-

ence, addressed to the person who is dealing

with doubt.

*Pastor Sather*



*Ask the Lord Jesus to renew your faith in His*

*great gift each day, so you will trust in Him to*

*give you lesser gifts. *
original_reflection_text:
Do you ever think that you are not good enough
for God, so He surely will not save you? Do you
ever feel as if salvation is for everyone else?
Then this verse is especially for you. If God gave
His Son for the world, He isn’t going to hold the
the gift of salvation from you! If Christ gave His
life for you, He isn’t going to turn around and condemn you! He will not withhold anything
you need to serve Him. The book of Roman’s is an explanation of God’s redeeming grace it’s meant to be a book of comfort and confide ence, addressed to the person who is dealing with doubt.
original_verse_text: Since God did not even spare His own Son but gave Him up for us all, won’t God, who gave us  Christ, also give us everything else?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our unworthiness. Yet, Your Word declares that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us (Romans 5:8). We are in awe of Your unfailing love and the gift of salvation You have freely offered us. Lord, help us to cast aside our doubts and fears, and to fully embrace the truth that if You have given us Your Son, You will not withhold any good thing from us (Romans 8:32). Fill us with Your Spirit, that we may serve You with confidence and joy. Amen.
reflection: Do you ever think that you are not good enough for God, so He surely will not save you? Do you ever feel as if salvation is for everyone else? Then this verse is especially for you. If God gave His Son for the world, He isn't going to hold the gift of salvation from you! If Christ gave His life for you, He isn't going to turn around and condemn you! He will not withhold anything you need to serve Him. The book of Romans is an explanation of God's redeeming grace. It's meant to be a book of comfort and confidence, addressed to the person who is dealing with doubt.
subject: Believing in the Word
verse_text: Since God did not even spare His own Son but gave Him up for us all, won’t God, who gave us  Christ, also give us everything else?

original_content:
message_id: 177791e6cd454706
subject   : 
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 6 Feb 2021 14:52:53 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: THE INDWELLING GOD *

(2-7-21)



*Today’s Verse:*

*I pray that from His glorious, unlimited resources He will give you His
might *

*inner strength through His Holy Spirit. *

*And I pray that Christ will be more and *

*more at home in your hearts as you trust *

*in Him. May your roots go down deep *

*into the soil of God’s marvelous love. *

(Eph. 3:16-17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Bible teaches the indwelling of the

Triune God in believers. This divine indwell-

ing in Christians is totally different from

pagan enthusiasm, however.The apostles

clearly stated that God’s presence in

our hearts comes “through faith.” This

faith in the atoning merit of Jesus Christ

as our Savior. It is created and sustained

only through means of grace: Word and

sacraments. It is not based on human

feelings or emotions but on the truths of

God’s Word.

*Pastor Sather*



*We need to pray that the Father, Son, *

*and Holy** Spirit, will dwell within us *

*to strengthen us for** the mission of the church. *
original_reflection_text:
The Bible teaches the indwelling of the Triune God in believers. This divine indwell ing in Christians is totally different from pagan enthusiasm, however.The apostles clearly stated that God’s presence in
our hearts comes “through faith.” This faith in the atoning merit of Jesus Christ as our Savior. It is created and sustained only through means of grace: Word and sacraments. It is not based on human
feelings or emotions but on the truths of God’s Word.
original_verse_text: I pray that from His glorious, unlimited resources He will give you His might  inner strength through His Holy Spirit.  And I pray that Christ will be more and  more at home in your hearts as you trust  in Him. May your roots go down deep  into the soil of God’s marvelous love.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your indwelling presence in our lives through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. By the power of Your Holy Spirit, strengthen us in our inner being, that Christ may dwell in our hearts, and that we may be rooted and grounded in Your love. Guide us to walk in a manner worthy of You, bearing fruit and growing in the knowledge of Your truth. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The Bible teaches the indwelling of the Triune God in believers. This divine indwelling in Christians is totally different from pagan enthusiasm, however. The apostles clearly stated that God's presence in our hearts comes "through faith." This faith in the atoning merit of Jesus Christ as our Savior is created and sustained only through means of grace: Word and sacraments. It is not based on human feelings or emotions but on the truths of God's Word.
subject: The Indwelling God
verse_text: I pray that from His glorious, unlimited resources He will give you His might  inner strength through His Holy Spirit.  And I pray that Christ will be more and  more at home in your hearts as you trust  in Him. May your roots go down deep  into the soil of God’s marvelous love.

original_content:
message_id: 1777ebccb87d9977
subject   : Subject: OUR PARTNERSHIP IN THE GOSPEL (2-8-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 7 Feb 2021 17:03:58 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*My job was to plant the seed in your hearts, and Apollos **watered it but
it was God, not *

*we, who made it grow. *(I Cor. 3:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul planted the seed of the Good News message in people’s hearts. He was a
missionary pioneer; he brought the mess-

age of salvation. Apollos watered the seed.

He helped the believers grow stronger in

the faith. Paul founded the church in Cor-

inth, and Apollos built on the foundation. Tragically, the believers in
Corinth had

split into factions, pledging loyalty to diff-

erent teachers (I Cor. 1:11-13). After the preachers’ work is completed, God
is the

one who makes Christians grow. Our lead-

ers should certainly be respected, but we should not put them on a pedestal
that creat-

es barriers between people or set them up as

a substitute for Christ.

* Pastor Sather*



*Ask the Holy Spirt to bless the preaching *

*of** Christ’s Gospel in the world and the testimony **we give by our
personal words *

*and deeds.*
original_reflection_text:
Paul planted the seed of the Good News message in people’s hearts. He was a missionary pioneer; he brought the mess age of salvation. Apollos watered the seed. He helped the believers grow stronger in
the faith. Paul founded the church in Corinthians inth, and Apollos built on the foundation. Tragically, the believers in Corinth had split into factions, pledging loyalty to diff erent teachers (I Corinthians 1:11-13). After the preachers’ work is completed, God is the one who makes Christians grow. Our lead ers should certainly be respected, but we should not put them on a pedestal that creat es barriers between people or set them up as a substitute for Christ.
original_verse_text: My job was to plant the seed in your hearts, and Apollos watered it but it was God, not  we, who made it grow.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the faithful servants who have planted the seeds of Your Gospel and watered the faith of Your people. Help us to recognize that it is You alone who causes the growth and the increase in our lives. May we not divide ourselves into factions, but instead unite under the banner of Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. May our leaders point us always to You, the true source of our salvation. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Paul planted the seed of the Good News message in people’s hearts. He was a missionary pioneer; he brought the mess age of salvation. Apollos watered the seed. He helped the believers grow stronger in the faith. Paul founded the church in Corinthians inth, and Apollos built on the foundation. Tragically, the believers in Corinth had split into factions, pledging loyalty to diff erent teachers (I Corinthians 1:11-13). After the preachers’ work is completed, God is the one who makes Christians grow. Our lead ers should certainly be respected, but we should not put them on a pedestal that creat es barriers between people or set them up as a substitute for Christ.
subject: Our Partnership in the Gospel
verse_text: My job was to plant the seed in your hearts, and Apollos watered it but it was God, not  we, who made it grow.

original_content:
message_id: 177840804680712a
subject   : Subject: RIGHTEOUS IN GOD'S EYES (2-9-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 8 Feb 2021 17:44:14 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*I tell you, this sinner, not the Pharisee, returned home justified before
God,*

*for the proud will be humbled, but *

*the humble will be justified. *(Lk. 18:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We do well to follow those wh0 appreciate

it when others sincerely and truthfully call their attention to spiritual
shortcomings. It helps us to arrive at a proper self-evaluation.

It is critical that we see ourselves as forgiven people having God’s full
approval for Jesus’ sake.This is in Robert Burn’s expression a “giftie”
only God can give. “It is by grace

you have been saved, through faith—and is not from yourselves, it is the
gift of God.” (Eph. 2:8)

*Pastor Sather*



*There are times we need to ask God to give *

*us **full understanding of what it means** to be *

*forgiven for Jesus sake and to see ourselves In this light.*
original_reflection_text: We do well to follow those wh0 appreciate it when others sincerely and truthfully call their attention to spiritual shortcomings. It helps us to arrive at a proper self-evaluation. It is critical that we see ourselves as forgiven people having God’s full approval for Jesus’ sake.This is in Robert Burn’s expression a “giftie” only God can give. “It is by grace you have been saved, through faith-and is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God.” (Ephesians 2:8)
original_verse_text: I tell you, this sinner, not the Pharisee, returned home justified before God, for the proud will be humbled, but  the humble will be justified.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our need for Your grace and forgiveness. Help us to see ourselves as You see us, not through the lens of our own self-evaluation, but through the lens of Your perfect love and acceptance in Christ. May we be quick to receive the gift of self-awareness that You graciously provide, that we may grow in holiness and draw ever closer to You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: We do well to follow those who appreciate it when others sincerely and truthfully call their attention to spiritual shortcomings. It helps us to arrive at a proper self-evaluation. It is critical that we see ourselves as forgiven people having God's full approval for Jesus' sake. This is, in Robert Burns' expression, a "giftie" only God can give. "It is by grace you have been saved, through faith—and is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God." (Ephesians 2:8)
subject: Righteous in God's Eyes
verse_text: I tell you, this sinner, not the Pharisee, returned home justified before God, for the proud will be humbled, but  the humble will be justified.

original_content:
message_id: 1778910f57d20abb
subject   : Subject: LEAVE ALL WITH GOD (2-10-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 9 Feb 2021 17:12:06 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not **lean on your own
understanding. In all your ways **acknowledge Him, and He will make
straight your **paths. *(Pro. 3:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When we have an important decision to

make, we sometimes feel we can’t trust anyone—*not **even God*! *But* God
knows what is best for us He is a better judge

of what we need then we are! We

must trust Him completely in every choice we make. We should not omit
careful thinking or belittle our God-

given ability to reason; but we should

Not trust our own ideas to the exclus-

ion of All others. We must not be wise

in our own eyes but be willing to listen

to and be corrected by God’s Word and wise counselors. Bring your decisions

to God in prayer use the Bible as you guide; and then follow God’s leading.

He will direct your paths by both guid-ing and protecting you.


*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
When we have an important decision to make, we sometimes feel we can’t trust anyone-not even God!
But God knows what is best for us He is a better judge of what we need then we are! We must trust Him completely in every choice we make. We should not omit careful thinking or belittle our God given ability to reason; but we should
Not trust our own ideas to the exclus ion of All others. We must not be wise in our own eyes but be willing to listen to and be corrected by God’s Word and wise counselors. Bring your decisions to God in prayer use the Bible as you guide; and then follow God’s leading. He will direct your paths by both guiding and protecting you.
original_verse_text: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make straight your paths.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with our decisions and uncertainties, acknowledging that Your ways are higher than our own. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts, leaning not on our own understanding. Guide us by Your Word and wise counsel, that we may walk in the paths You have prepared for us. Direct our steps, that we may glorify Your name in all we do. Amen.
reflection: When we have an important decision to make, we sometimes feel we can’t trust anyone-not even God! But God knows what is best for us He is a better judge of what we need then we are! We must trust Him completely in every choice we make. We should not omit careful thinking or belittle our God given ability to reason; but we should Not trust our own ideas to the exclus ion of All others. We must not be wise in our own eyes but be willing to listen to and be corrected by God’s Word and wise counselors. Bring your decisions to God in prayer use the Bible as you guide; and then follow God’s leading. He will direct your paths by both guiding and protecting you.
subject: Leave All with God
verse_text: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make straight your paths.

original_content:
message_id: 1778e69efcf8d53e
subject   : Subject: WE ARE CHRIST'S GUESTS (2-11-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 10 Feb 2021 18:07:23 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Then Jesus directed them to have all people *

*sit down in **groups on the green grass. *

(Mk. 6:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Divine grace really means that we are

Christ’s guests. We come to His holy

meal empty handed. Salvation is God’s

outright gift—we contribute nothing.

The Good Shepherd, who laid down His

life on our behalf, leads us to the “green

grass” of His Word, providing all we need

for our spiritual nurture. We sing, “*The *

*Lord is My Shepherd, I’ll not want;*

*He makes me lie down in green pastures; *

*He leads me **by quiet waters.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Let us express our gratefulness to the *

*Savior for having **us as His guests and *

*for providing for all our needs.*
original_reflection_text:
Divine grace really means that we are Christ’s guests. We come to His holy meal empty handed. Salvation is God’s
outright gift-we contribute nothing. The Good Shepherd, who laid down His life on our behalf, leads us to the “green
grass” of His Word, providing all we need for our spiritual nurture.
We sing, “The Lord is My Shepherd, I’ll not want; He makes me lie down in green pastures; He leads me by quiet waters.
original_verse_text: Then Jesus directed them to have all people  sit down in groups on the green grass.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to Your table as Your guests, empty-handed, for our salvation is Your outright gift. We are grateful that the Good Shepherd, who laid down His life for us, leads us to the green pastures of Your Word, providing all we need for our spiritual nourishment. Guide us by Your quiet waters, that we may find rest and restoration in Your presence. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Divine grace really means that we are Christ's guests. We come to His holy meal empty-handed. Salvation is God's outright gift—we contribute nothing. The Good Shepherd, who laid down His life on our behalf, leads us to the "green grass" of His Word, providing all we need for our spiritual nurture. We sing, "The Lord is My Shepherd, I'll not want; He makes me lie down in green pastures; He leads me by quiet waters."
subject: We are Christ's Guests
verse_text: Then Jesus directed them to have all people  sit down in groups on the green grass.

original_content:
message_id: 1779364ccd951fe1
subject   : Subject: HAVING A RESPONSIBILITY (2-12-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 11 Feb 2021 17:19:53 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“You will be my witness in Jerusalem, *

*and all Judea **and Samaria, and to the *

*ends of the earth. *(Acts 18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

How wonderful it is to see that Christ’s

church continues to grow. *But, *it has *not *

been completed just because *these places*

have been evangelized. remember our Lord

says to every generation: “You will be my

witnesses *. . . *to the ends of the earth.”

*To this day **ALL* of Christ’s followers are

to teach all nations the Word of salvation

and baptize them in the name of the Triune

God. He who suffered and died for the sins

of mankind says “That Christ will suffer

and rise from the dead on the third day, and repentance and forgiveness of sins
will be

preached in His name to all nations, begin-

ning at Jerusalem” (Lk. 24:46-47) *Remem-*

*ber* it is our call and privilege to be Christ’s witnesses wherever we are
in this world

and to send missionaries to places beyond our reach.

*Pastor Sather*

*We need to ask the risen and ascended *

*Savior to equip** us to be His witness at *

*home, at work, in School, and** in our community.*
original_reflection_text:
How wonderful it is to see that Christ’s church continues to grow. But, it has not been completed just because these places have been evangelized.
remember our Lord says to every generation: “You will be my
witnesses . . . to the ends of the earth.” To this day ALL of Christ’s followers are to teach all nations the Word of salvation and baptize them in the name of the Triune God. He who suffered and died for the sins of mankind says “That Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day, and repentance and forgiveness of sins will be preached in His name to all nations, begin ning at Jerusalem” (Luke 24:46-47) Remem ber it is our call and privilege to be Christ’s witnesses wherever we are in this world and to send missionaries to places beyond our reach.
original_verse_text: “You will be my witness in Jerusalem,  and all Judea and Samaria, and to the  ends of the earth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the continued growth of Your church and the great commission You have entrusted to us. May we be empowered by Your Holy Spirit to be Your witnesses, proclaiming the good news of salvation and making disciples of all nations. Help us to heed Your call, teaching Your Word and baptizing in the name of the Triune God, that Your kingdom may come and Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Amen.
reflection: How wonderful it is to see that Christ's church continues to grow. But, it has not been completed just because these places have been evangelized. Remember our Lord says to every generation: "You will be my witnesses . . . to the ends of the earth." To this day, all of Christ's followers are to teach all nations the Word of salvation and baptize them in the name of the Triune God. He who suffered and died for the sins of mankind says "That Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day, and repentance and forgiveness of sins will be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem" (Luke 24:46-47). Remember, it is our call and privilege to be Christ's witnesses wherever we are in this world and to send missionaries to places beyond our reach.
subject: Having a Responsibility
verse_text: “You will be my witness in Jerusalem,  and all Judea and Samaria, and to the  ends of the earth.

original_content:
message_id: 17798baac683e4ed
subject   : Subject: CLEAR THE AIR BEFORE SUNDOWN (2-13-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 12 Feb 2021 18:11:47 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Don’t sin by letting your anger gain control over you. Don’t let the sun
go down while *

*you are still angry *(Eph. 4:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Bible doesn’t tell us that we shouldn’t

feel angry, but points out that it is important

to handle our anger properly. If vented thoughtlessly, anger can hurt
others and destroy relationships. If bottled up inside,

it can cause us to become bitter and destroy

us from within. Paul tells us to deal with

our anger immediately in a way that builds relationships rather than
destroy them. If we nurse our anger, we will give Satan an
oppor-tunity to divide
us. Are you angry with some-

one right now? What can you do to resolve your differences? Don’t let the
day end be-

fore you begin to work on mending your relationship.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us thank Christ for reconciling man-*

*kind with **God so we can live in peace with others.*
original_reflection_text:
The Bible doesn’t tell us that we should’t feel angry, but points out that it is important to handle our anger properly. If vented thoughtlessly, anger can hurt others and destroy relationships. If bottled up inside, it can cause us to become bitter and destroy us from within. Paul tells us to deal with
our anger immediately in a way that builds relationships rather than destroy them. If we nurse our anger, we will give Satan an opportunity to divide us. Are you angry with some one right now? What can you do to resolve your differences? Don’t let the day end be fore you begin to work on mending your relationship.
original_verse_text: Don’t sin by letting your anger gain control over you. Don’t let the sun go down while  you are still angry.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You acknowledging the anger and hurt that sometimes arises within us. Help us to handle our emotions with wisdom, not letting the sun go down on our wrath, but instead seeking to forgive as You have forgiven us. May we not give the devil a foothold by harboring bitterness, but rather work to mend broken relationships through Your grace. Guide us, Lord, to resolve our differences in a way that honors You and builds up one another. Amen.
reflection: The Bible doesn’t tell us that we should’t feel angry, but points out that it is important to handle our anger properly. If vented thoughtlessly, anger can hurt others and destroy relationships. If bottled up inside, it can cause us to become bitter and destroy us from within. Paul tells us to deal with our anger immediately in a way that builds relationships rather than destroy them. If we nurse our anger, we will give Satan an opportunity to divide us. Are you angry with some one right now? What can you do to resolve your differences? Don’t let the day end be fore you begin to work on mending your relationship.
subject: Clear the Air Before Sundown
verse_text: Don’t sin by letting your anger gain control over you. Don’t let the sun go down while  you are still angry.

original_content:
message_id: 1779d5c271e59e2b
subject   : Subject: WHAT GOD INTENDED (2-14-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 13 Feb 2021 15:46:38 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“What God has joined together, let no man separate.” *(Mt. 19:6)

*Today’s Reflection:*

What has taken place is that the union of husband and wife

merges two persons in such a way that little can effect the

one without also affecting the other. Oneness in marriage

does not mean losing your personality in the personality

of the other. Instead, it means caring for your spouse as

you care for yourself, learning to anticipate his or her needs,

is helping the other to become all he or she can be. The

creation story tells of God’s plan that husband and wife

should be one (Gen. 2:24), and Jesus also referred to this

plan in (Mt. 19:4-6).

* Pastor Sather*



*Let our Valentine prayer be that the union of—and the*

*unity in—marriage everywhere maybe strengthened by*

*the self-sacrificing love of Christ. *



Let us remember to always be kind to our Valentine!
original_reflection_text:
What has taken place is that the union of husband and wife
merges two persons in such a way that little can effect the
one without also affecting the other. Oneness in marriage
does not mean losing your personality in the personality of the other. Instead, it means caring for your spouse as you care for yourself, learning to anticipate his or her needs,
is helping the other to become all he or she can be. The
creation story tells of God’s plan that husband and wife
should be one (Genesis 2:24), and Jesus also referred to this
plan in (Matthew 19:4-6).
original_verse_text: What God has joined together, let no man separate.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of marriage, where two become one flesh. Help us to cherish the oneness You have created, not losing our individuality but caring for our spouse as we care for ourselves. May we learn to anticipate each other's needs and support one another in becoming all that You have called us to be. Guide us to reflect the unity between Christ and the Church, as we seek to honor You in our marriage. Amen.
reflection: What has taken place is that the union of husband and wife merges two persons in such a way that little can affect the one without also affecting the other. Oneness in marriage does not mean losing your personality in the personality of the other. Instead, it means caring for your spouse as you care for yourself, learning to anticipate his or her needs, and helping the other to become all he or she can be. The creation story tells of God's plan that husband and wife should be one (Genesis 2:24), and Jesus also referred to this plan in (Matthew 19:4-6).
subject: What God Intended
verse_text: What God has joined together, let no man separate.

original_content:
message_id: 177a303de6b91d78
subject   : Subject: SPIRITUAL RENEWAL (2-15-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 14 Feb 2021 18:07:56 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*[He] satisfies your desires with good things so*

*that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s *(Ps. 103:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

David’s praise focused on God’s glorious deeds. Now we often find it easy
to com-

plain about life, but David’s list gives us plenty for which to praise God:
He forgives our sins, heals or diseases, redeems us from death, crowns us
with love and compassion, satisfies our desires, and gives righteous

ness and justice. We receive all these without

deserving any of them. No matter how difficult your life’s journey, you
can always count your blessings, past, present, and future. When you feel
as though you have nothing

for which to praise God, take time to read David’s list (Ps. 103:3-6).

* Pastor Sather*



*Let us remember to join David in giving thanks **to God for His renewing
grace in Christ and **for all His blessings that renew our life.*
original_reflection_text:
David’s praise focused on God’s glorious deeds. Now we often find it easy to com plain about life, but David’s list gives us plenty for which to praise God: He forgives our sins, heals or diseases, redeems us from death, crowns us with love and compassion, satisfies our desires, and gives righteous ness and justice. We receive all these without
deserving any of them. No matter how difficult your life’s journey, you can always count your blessings, past, present, and future. When you feel as though you have nothing for which to praise God, take time to read David’s list (Psalm 103:3-6).
original_verse_text: He satisfies your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, praising Your glorious deeds. You forgive our sins, heal our diseases, and redeem us from death. You crown us with love and compassion, satisfying our desires with good things. Though we may face difficulties, we count our blessings, past, present, and future, for Your righteousness and justice endure forever. We give thanks for Your abundant mercies. Amen.
reflection: David’s praise focused on God’s glorious deeds. Now we often find it easy to com plain about life, but David’s list gives us plenty for which to praise God: He forgives our sins, heals or diseases, redeems us from death, crowns us with love and compassion, satisfies our desires, and gives righteous ness and justice. We receive all these without deserving any of them. No matter how difficult your life’s journey, you can always count your blessings, past, present, and future. When you feel as though you have nothing for which to praise God, take time to read David’s list (Psalm 103:3-6).
subject: Spiritual Renewal
verse_text: He satisfies your desires with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

original_content:
message_id: 177a804722c8507b
subject   : Subject: FULL COVERAGE IN CHRIST (2-16-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 15 Feb 2021 17:26:40 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*All have sinned and fall short of the glory of God, *

*and are justified freely by His grace and through*

* the redemption that came through Christ Jesus.*

(Ro. 3:23-24)



*Today’s Reflection:*

As human sinfulness remains constant, so does

our need for God’s saving grace in Christ remains

constant. God’s new covenant with us, which is

the character of our salvation, offers full coverage.

None is excluded; none is told that he is only frac-

tionally redeemed (Perhaps three-fifths) and

that he must make up the rest himself. There is

no balance due, as through Christ pays a certain

amount of your debt and you are responsible for

the rest. *No,* *Jesus died to bring each one of us *

*salvation full and* *free.*

* Pastor Sather*



*Let us make this our prayer: “Redeemer, come!*

*I open wide my heart to Thee; Here, Lord, abide.*

*Amen. *
original_reflection_text:
As human sinfulness remains constant, so does
our need for God’s saving grace in Christ remains constant. God’s new covenant with us, which is
the character of our salvation, offers full coverage.
None is excluded; none is told that he is only frac tonally redeemed (Perhaps three-fifths)
and
that he must make up the rest himself. There is
no balance due, as through Christ pays a certain amount of your debt and you are responsible for
the rest. No, Jesus died to bring each one of us salvation full and free.
original_verse_text: All have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,  and are justified freely by His grace and through the redemption that came through Christ Jesus.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our constant need for Your saving grace in Christ. Though our sin remains, Your new covenant offers us full and free salvation, not partial redemption. Lord, we are grateful that through Jesus' sacrifice, there is no balance due, no debt left for us to pay. May we ever rest in the assurance of Your complete and unending love. Amen.
reflection: As human sinfulness remains constant, so does our need for God's saving grace in Christ remain constant. God's new covenant with us, which is the character of our salvation, offers full coverage. None is excluded; none is told that he is only fractionally redeemed (perhaps three-fifths) and that he must make up the rest himself. There is no balance due, as though Christ pays a certain amount of your debt and you are responsible for the rest. No, Jesus died to bring each one of us salvation, full and free.
subject: Full Coverage in Christ
verse_text: All have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,  and are justified freely by His grace and through the redemption that came through Christ Jesus.

original_content:
message_id: 177ad324144a7f3e
subject   : Subject: YOUTH CAN BE AN ASSET (2-17-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 16 Feb 2021 17:34:48 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Don’t let anyone think less of you because you are*

*young. Be an example to all believers in what you*

*teach in the way you live, in your love. your faith,*

*and your purity. *(I Tim.4:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Timothy was a young pastor. It would have been easy

for older Christians to look down on him because of

his youth. He had to earn the respect of his elders by

setting an example in his speech, love, faith, and purity. Regardless of
your age, God can use you. Whether

you are young or old, don’t think of your age as a handi-

cap. *Live so others can see Christ in you.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Let us remember to express our thankfulness to God for having blessed
Christ’s church with faithful teenagers as His precious gifts. *
original_reflection_text: Timothy was a young pastor. It would have been easy for older Christians to look down on him because of his youth. He had to earn the respect of his elders by setting an example in his speech, love, faith, and purity. Regardless of your age, God can use you. Whether you are young or old, don’t think of your age as a handi cap. Live so others can see Christ in you.
original_verse_text:
Don’t let anyone think less of you because you are young.
Be an example to all believers in what you teach in the way you live, in your love. your faith, and your purity.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the example of Timothy, who, despite his youth, lived with integrity and godliness, earning the respect of those around him. Lord, help us, too, to be examples of Your love and grace, regardless of our age or stage in life. May our speech, our actions, and our very lives reflect the transforming power of Your Spirit within us. Use us, Lord, to point others to the hope and salvation found in Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Timothy was a young pastor. It would have been easy for older Christians to look down on him because of his youth. He had to earn the respect of his elders by setting an example in his speech, love, faith, and purity. Regardless of your age, God can use you. Whether you are young or old, don't think of your age as a handicap. Live so others can see Christ in you.
subject: Youth Can be an Asset
verse_text:
Don’t let anyone think less of you because you are young.
Be an example to all believers in what you teach in the way you live, in your love. your faith, and your purity.

original_content:
message_id: 177b27d31d830a68
subject   : Subject: A PROPHET WHO PROFITS (2-18-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 17 Feb 2021 18:14:45 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*And you my child, will be called a prophet *

*of the **Most High, because you will prepare *

*the way of **the Lord. *(Lk. 1:76)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Zechariah had just recalled hundreds of

years of God’s sovereign work in history, beginning with Abraham and going
on in-

to eternity. Then, intender contrast he personalized the story. His Son had
been

chosen for the key role in the drama of

the ages. Although God has unlimited

power, He chooses to work through frail humans who begin as helpless babes.

*Don’t minimize what God **can do *

*through those who are faithful to Him.*

* Pastor Sather*



*Let us never forget to thank the Lord *

*Jesus for **being the great Prophet, proclaiming and con**veying the
great *

*blessing of full salvation in **Him.*
original_reflection_text:
Zechariah had just recalled hundreds of years of God’s sovereign work in history, beginning with Abraham and going on in to eternity. Then, intenser contrast he personalized the story. His Son had been chosen for the key role in the drama of
the ages. Although God has unlimited power, He chooses to work through frail humans who begin as helpless babes. Don’t minimize what God can do through those who are faithful to Him.
original_verse_text: And you my child, will be called a prophet  of the Most High, because you will prepare  the way of the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your sovereign plan, unfolding throughout the ages. Just as You prepared the way for Your Son through the faithful ministry of John the Baptist, we pray that You would use us, Your humble servants, to proclaim the good news of salvation. Grant us the courage and wisdom to fulfill the purpose You have set before us, that many may come to know the light of Your truth. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Zechariah had just recalled hundreds of years of God's sovereign work in history, beginning with Abraham and going on into eternity. Then, in stark contrast, he personalized the story. His Son had been chosen for the key role in the drama of the ages. Although God has unlimited power, He chooses to work through frail humans who begin as helpless babes. Don't minimize what God can do through those who are faithful to Him.
subject: A Prophet Who Profits
verse_text: And you my child, will be called a prophet  of the Most High, because you will prepare  the way of the Lord.

original_content:
message_id: 177b79ccf31c9c14
subject   : Subject: FAMINE OF THE WORLD (2-19-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 18 Feb 2021 18:07:23 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“The time is surely coming,” says the Sovereign Lord, “when I will send a
famine*

*on the land—**not a famine of bread or water but of hearing the Word of
the Lord.”* (Amos 8:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The people had no appetite for God’s Word when prophets like Amos brought
it. Because of their apathy, God said He would take away even the
opportunity to hear His word. We have His Word, the Bible. But many still
look everywhere for answers to life’s problems except in scriptures. You
can help them by directing them to the Bible, showing them

the parts that speak to their special needs and questions. God’s Word is
available to us. *Let us help people know it* *before a time comes when
they can not find it.*

* Pastor Sather*



*Let us ask God to grant us the continual *

*use of His Word and the sacraments, that through them we may be nurtured
and strengthened. *
original_reflection_text: The people had no appetite for God’s Word when prophets like Amos brought it. Because of their apathy, God said He would take away even the opportunity to hear His word. We have His Word, the Bible. But many still look everywhere for answers to life’s problems except in scriptures. You can help them by directing them to the Bible, showing them the parts that speak to their special needs and questions. God’s Word is available to us. Let us help people know it before a time comes when they can not find it.
original_verse_text: "The time is surely coming," says the Sovereign Lord, "when I will send a famine on the land not a famine of bread or water but of hearing the Word of the Lord."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts for the gift of Your Word, the Bible, which is a lamp to our feet and a light to our path. Forgive us for the times when we have neglected or taken for granted this precious treasure. Help us to hunger and thirst for Your truth, and to share it with those who are seeking answers to life's challenges. May Your Word never be taken away from us, but may it continue to guide and sustain us, that we may walk in Your ways and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The people had no appetite for God's Word when prophets like Amos brought it. Because of their apathy, God said He would take away even the opportunity to hear His word. We have His Word, the Bible. But many still look everywhere for answers to life's problems except in the Scriptures. You can help them by directing them to the Bible, showing them the parts that speak to their special needs and questions. God's Word is available to us. Let us help people know it before a time comes when they cannot find it.
subject: Famine of the World
verse_text: "The time is surely coming," says the Sovereign Lord, "when I will send a famine on the land not a famine of bread or water but of hearing the Word of the Lord."

original_content:
message_id: 177c15f8a0083e82
subject   : Subject: FOLLOWING GOD'S REQUEST (2-21-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 20 Feb 2021 15:36:40 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Comfort, comfort My people, says your God.*

(Isa. 40:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

“Comfort, comfort My people” is the most

appropriate Lenten text. Forgiveness in Christ, the Lamb of God, is the
comfort that pastor’s bring to the ailing and failing members of the church.
In this they have

the assistance of elders and deacons in the congregation who pray for the
sick (Jm. 5:

14-15). And not only they but all members

of the church bring words of hope and

cheer to sorrowful and suffering brothers

and sisters in the faith. *That is how we *

*can streng**then one another in the communion of saints.*

*Pastor Sather*



*Let us ask the Holy Spirit, our comforter, *

*to keep** us in the fellowship of faith, that *

*we may be com**forters to one another in Jesus’ name.*
original_reflection_text:
“Comfort, comfort My people” is the most
appropriate Lenten text. Forgiveness in Christ, the Lamb of God, is the comfort that pastor’s bring to the ailing and failing members of the church.
In this they have the assistance of elders and deacons in the congregation who pray for the sick (James 5: 14-15). And not only they but all members of the church bring words of hope and
cheer to sorrowful and suffering brothers and sisters in the faith. That is how we can strengthen one another in the communion of saints.
original_verse_text: Comfort, comfort My people, says your God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you with grateful hearts, seeking your comfort and healing for your people. As your servants minister to the ailing and failing, grant them the wisdom and strength to proclaim the forgiveness found in Christ, the Lamb of God. We ask that the elders and deacons of the church would faithfully lift up the sick in prayer, that they may be restored and renewed by your grace. May all members of the communion of saints offer words of hope and cheer to our brothers and sisters in need, that we may be strengthened and encouraged in our faith. We trust in your unfailing love and mercy. Amen.
reflection: "Comfort, comfort My people" is the most appropriate Lenten text. Forgiveness in Christ, the Lamb of God, is the comfort that pastors bring to the ailing and failing members of the church. In this, they have the assistance of elders and deacons in the congregation who pray for the sick (James 5:14-15). And not only they, but all members of the church, bring words of hope and cheer to sorrowful and suffering brothers and sisters in the faith. That is how we can strengthen one another in the communion of saints.
subject: Following God's Request
verse_text: Comfort, comfort My people, says your God.

original_content:
message_id: 177c6816d94bebef
subject   : Subject: HOPE FOR RESTORATION: (2-22-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 21 Feb 2021 15:31:47 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Even the wilderness will rejoice in those *

*days. The **desert will blossom with flowers. *(Isa. 35:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In the next 34 verses Isaiah delivers a mess-

age of judgement on all nations, including Israel and Judah, for rejecting
God.

Although there have been glimpses of relief

and restoration for the remanent of faithful

believers, the climate of wrath, fury, judge-ment, and destruction, still
prevailed.

Now in verse one Isaiah comes through

with a vision of beauty and encourage-

ment. God is just in His mercy as He is in

His judgement. God’s complete moral perfection is revealed by his hatred
for all

sin, and this leads to judgement.

This same moral perfection is revealed in

His love for all He has created. This leads

to mercy for those who have sinned but

who have sincerely loved Jesus and put

their trust in Him.

*Pastor Sather*

*Remember that scriptures tell us prayer changes **things. The bible says,
“The effectual fervent **prayer of a righteous *

*man avails much” *(Jm. 5:16)
original_reflection_text:
In the next 34 verses Isaiah delivers a mess age of judgment on all nations, including Israel and Judah, for rejecting God. Although there have been glimpses of relief and restoration for the remanent of faithful
believers, the climate of wrath, fury, judge-ment, and destruction, still prevailed. Now in verse one Isaiah comes through with a vision of beauty and encourage ment.
God is just in His mercy as He is in His judgment.
God’s complete moral perfection is revealed by his hatred for all sin, and this leads to judgment.
This same moral perfection is revealed in His love for all He has created. This leads to mercy for those who have sinned but who have sincerely loved Jesus and put their trust in Him.
original_verse_text: Even the wilderness will rejoice in those  days. The  desert will blossom with flowers.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your perfect justice and Your boundless mercy. Though Your righteous judgment falls upon the unrepentant, You have promised a day of restoration and renewal for those who trust in You. May the desert blossom like the crocus, and the parched land burst forth with joy and singing, for You are the God who redeems and restores. We cling to Your promises, Lord, and await the fulfillment of Your glorious kingdom. Amen.
reflection: In the next 34 verses Isaiah delivers a mess age of judgment on all nations, including Israel and Judah, for rejecting God. Although there have been glimpses of relief and restoration for the remanent of faithful believers, the climate of wrath, fury, judge-ment, and destruction, still prevailed. Now in verse one Isaiah comes through with a vision of beauty and encourage ment. God is just in His mercy as He is in His judgment. God’s complete moral perfection is revealed by his hatred for all sin, and this leads to judgment. This same moral perfection is revealed in His love for all He has created. This leads to mercy for those who have sinned but who have sincerely loved Jesus and put their trust in Him.
subject: Hope for Restoration
verse_text: Even the wilderness will rejoice in those  days. The  desert will blossom with flowers.

original_content:
message_id: 177cc1e6120d3bdd
subject   : Subject: CAUSE TO CELEBRATE (2-23-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 22 Feb 2021 17:41:19 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“He calls his friends and neighbors together and **says, Rejoice with me;
I have found my lost sheep!” *(Lk. 15:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Why this great Joy? It means the recovery

of a human soul worth more than all the material wealth of the world. It
means the reinstatement of a person for whose redemp-

tion Jesus Christ shed His precious blood.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let your prayer be an intercession for someone who **is a spiritual
drop-out.*
original_reflection_text: Why this great Joy? It means the recovery of a human soul worth more than all the material wealth of the world. It means the reinstatement of a person for whose redemp tion Jesus Christ shed His precious blood.
original_verse_text: He calls his friends and neighbors together and says, Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for your relentless pursuit of the lost, for your joy in the recovery of a single soul. May we share in your delight when the prodigal returns home, remembering that each person is of infinite value, redeemed by the blood of your Son. Grant us wisdom and compassion to seek the wandering, that we may join in the celebration when the lost are found. Amen.
reflection: Why this great joy? It means the recovery of a human soul worth more than all the material wealth of the world. It means the reinstatement of a person for whose redemption Jesus Christ shed His precious blood.
subject: Cause to Celebrate
verse_text: He calls his friends and neighbors together and says, Rejoice with me; I have found my lost sheep!

original_content:
message_id: 177d0f0cc262c43a
subject   : Subject: HEAVEN--WHAT IS THERE (2-24-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 23 Feb 2021 16:09:38 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*There will be no more night. They will not need the **light of a lamp or
the light of the *

*sun, for the Lord **God will give them light. *(Rev. 22:5)


*Today’s Reflection**:*

Heaven is described as an extraordinary

place. Life in heaven is so different from

our earthly life that literal language and

human imagination *cannot* begin to des-

cribe its realities. To be in the presence

of our heavenly Father as children recon-

ciled and redeemed by the Lamb of God—*THAT IS HEAVEN IN BRIEF.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Pray that God, for Jesus’ sake, may pre-*

*serve in you **the glorious vision of eternal *

*life to come. *
original_reflection_text:
:
Heaven is described as an extraordinary place. Life in heaven is so different from our earthly life that literal language and human imagination cannot begin to des cribe its realities. To be in the presence of our heavenly Father as children recon ciled and redeemed by the Lamb of God-THAT IS HEAVEN IN BRIEF.
original_verse_text: There will be no more night. They will not need the light of a lamp or the light of the  sun, for the Lord God will give them light.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that in Your eternal kingdom, there will be no need for the sun or moon, for Your glory will be our light, and the Lamb will be our lamp. We long for the day when we will dwell in Your presence forever, no longer plagued by the darkness and brokenness of this world, but basking in the radiant splendor of Your glory. Lord, prepare our hearts to behold the wonders of Your heavenly kingdom, where we will worship You, the Lamb, for all eternity. Amen.
reflection: Heaven is described as an extraordinary place. Life in heaven is so different from our earthly life that literal language and human imagination cannot begin to describe its realities. To be in the presence of our heavenly Father as children reconciled and redeemed by the Lamb of God—that is heaven in brief.
subject: Heaven--What is There
verse_text: There will be no more night. They will not need the light of a lamp or the light of the  sun, for the Lord God will give them light.

original_content:
message_id: 177d65520abeec81
subject   : Subject: AN INCREDIBLE CHANGE (2-25-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 24 Feb 2021 17:17:19 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, He is a *

*new creation;** the old has gone, the new *

*has come. *(II Cor. 5:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Through forgiveness the arms of Jesus lift

you—His blood cleanse you—and His love changes you-- It is His free gift to
you.

Turn your heart toward Jesus*. *

* Pastor Sather*


*Pray to **r**eceive Him and His **forgiveness *

*by faith today*—*He will come into **your heart and make all things new*.
. .
original_reflection_text: Through forgiveness the arms of Jesus lift you-His blood cleanse you-and His love changes you-- It is His free gift to you. Turn your heart toward Jesus.
original_verse_text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, He is a  new creation; the old has gone, the new  has come.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your boundless grace and the transformative power of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Through His sacrifice, we have been made new, buried with Him in baptism and raised to walk in newness of life. May our hearts ever turn towards You, Lord, that we may live as Your redeemed children, reflecting the light of Your love to all. Amen.
reflection: Through forgiveness, the arms of Jesus lift you. His blood cleanses you, and His love changes you. It is His free gift to you. Turn your heart toward Jesus.
subject: An Incredible Change
verse_text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, He is a  new creation; the old has gone, the new  has come.
